fxInfo_citation: Pemstein et al. (2018, V-Dem Working Paper Series 2018:21); V-Dem Codebook (see suggested citation at the top of this document).
fxInfo_cross_coder_aggregation: Bayesian Item Response Theory Measurement Model
fxInfo_question: In practice, is the approval of the upper chamber of the legislature required to pass legislation?

fxInfo_responses.value: No. Legislation is routinely passed without the approval of the upper chamber of the legislature.
Yes, usually. Legislation is usually passed with the approval of the upper chamber of the legislature, but occasionally the legislature is by-passed.
Yes, always. Legislation of any consequence is always approved by the upper chamber of the legislature.

fxInfo_scale: Ordinal, converted to interval by the measurement model
name: v2lglegpup, *_osp, *_ord
